definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: Houyi some magic pills that could make him live forever.
sentences.chinese: 他給了后羿一些能使他長生不老的仙丹。

sentences.english: It is said that drinking the water of Heaven Spring Waterfall will make one long-lived.
sentences.chinese: 據說常喝天泉瀑的水能長生不老。

sentences.english: Elixirs are concentrated alcohol extractions that are similar to both teas and tinctures .
sentences.chinese: 長生不老藥是濃縮的酒精萃取物，類似於茶和酊劑。

sentences.english: And" tender is the way to make your life and keep the love ever-young of medicine."
sentences.chinese: 而且“溫柔是使人生和愛情保持長生不老的仙藥。”

sentences.english: People in ancient times spent a fortune on elixirs for fear of dying.
sentences.chinese: 古時候的人因爲怕死，因此花很多錢在長生不老藥。

sentences.english: She ascended from earth to live on the moon as a celestial being after drinking an elixir.
sentences.chinese: 她喫下長生不老藥後化作仙女，從地球升到了月球上。

sentences.english: Accompanied Chang, and ramming system elixir.
sentences.chinese: 陪同嫦娥，並搗制長生不老藥。

sentences.english: I have developed a new product that is the fountain of youth.
sentences.chinese: 我研發出了一種長生不老泉。

sentences.english: She’d want to know how doctors ended up curing cancer and senility.
sentences.chinese: 她會想知道醫生們是如何治癒癌症並使人長生不老。

sentences.english: Kombucha can be traced back to ancient China where it was worshipped as a remedy for immortality.
sentences.chinese: 康普茶可追溯到古代中國，它作爲長生不老藥被崇拜。

sentences.english: All you have to do is stay down there and sniff it and you can live forever.
sentences.chinese: 你只要呆在井裏聞聞它，你就可以長生不老了。

sentences.english: Chang'e and her husband Houyi were immortals who lived in Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 嫦娥和她的丈夫后羿長生不老的生活在天上。

sentences.english: Enthusiasm is that long-sought-after fountain of eternal life.
sentences.chinese: 熱忱是古今中外人們所追求的長生不老之泉。

sentences.english: Who's to say they couldn't eat of that and just live forever?
sentences.chinese: 有誰說過不要喫生命樹，吃了便能長生不老？

sentences.english: Are if you have 2 elixirs, you met to who to eat?
sentences.chinese: 如果你有2顆長生不老藥你會把給誰喫？

sentences.english: But Chu was an old man, and nobody lives forever.
sentences.chinese: 老楚年紀大了，沒人能長生不老。

definition: to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
to help the dying and heal the injured
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
